channel.title: Need help with car
channel.description:
So I have been working on my car and at first it would only click and make these clicking sounds when I tried to start it. So I put in a new starter and now when I try to start it, it sounds like it is about to start it starts rumming but it wont completely turn over. So I checked the ignition coil and I noticed there is no electricity or sparks or pulses going through it.
I had a friend come over and he said it is either the pickup sensor on the distributor or we just need a new ignition coil.
For those car guys out there any suggestions would be great or any thoughts or ideas you think might be the problem would help greatly!
And I checked the gas as well and it is filled. And we have a new battery.

item.title: Need help with car
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I doubt it’s the same issue but I know the alternator relates to the battery in someway/fashion. On our 2003 expedition as well there are tomes when the spark plugs or the wiring for the spark plugs have caused us issues during start up ( that and also when driving it’s like the expedition jumps )

Another viable tool would be to get some advice on the Best Buy forums they have a section purely for auto and one of their Super Users named AutoTech is a wiz at all this technical stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with car
item.dc:creator: @Mack_n_cheese Mack n cheese
item.description:
@Mack_n_cheese wrote:

Even though your batteries new, I’d check there cause I had that same exact issue and it was because my battery wasn’t giving power.

Read full topic

So I put in a new starter and now when I try to start it, it sounds like it is about to start it starts rumming but it wont completely turn over. So I checked the ignition coil and I noticed there is no electricity or sparks or pulses going through it.

I had a friend come over and he said it is either the pickup sensor on the distributor or we just need a new ignition coil.

For those car guys out there any suggestions would be great or any thoughts or ideas you think might be the problem would help greatly!

And I checked the gas as well and it is filled.
And we have a new battery.[/quote]

When you put the starter in did you check to see if it engages the clutch?
